description: Grade 3 Coding - Themed Game Projects (5 Examples)

project_templates.tagline: Build your own spaceship and dodge the asteroids!
project_templates.what_kids_build: A playable game where their spaceship avoids obstacles
project_templates.why_exciting: They get a REAL game they can play and show friends

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Your spaceship is about to fly through an asteroid field! But wait... how does the spaceship know when it's been hit? Let's teach it to DETECT collisions!

teaching_script.gigi_says: Spaceships need to know when they crash! We use IF blocks to check.
teaching_script.voice_text: Your spaceship asks: Am I touching an asteroid? If YES, boom! If NO, keep flying!

teaching_script.gigi_says: The IF block is like a space sensor. It checks for danger!
teaching_script.voice_text: This code checks FOREVER. Touching asteroid? BOOM, game over. Not touching? Keep flying!

teaching_script.gigi_says: Without IF blocks, your spaceship would fly right through asteroids like a ghost!
teaching_script.voice_text: See the difference? IF makes your game REAL! Collisions actually matter!

rule_card.title: Collision Detection
rule_card.rule: IF <touching something?> THEN do something! This makes your game react to crashes!

phase_2_demo.intro: Watch me build the collision detection for your spaceship!

walkthrough.voice: We need to check for collisions ALL the time, so forever loop!
Inside forever, add the IF block. Put touching asteroid in the diamond.
When hit, let's make it dramatic! Play explosion sound, say BOOM!
Game over means everything stops. Add stop all.
Move the spaceship into the asteroid... BOOM! It works!
What if the spaceship goes off screen? Let's fix that!
When touching edge, either bounce back or appear on the other side!
Now let's add a power-up! Touching the shield = temporary protection!
Set shield to ON, then use another IF to check if shielded before exploding!

phase_3_guided_practice.intro: Your turn! Let's build your Space Dodger together!

challenges.prompt:
Complete the code so your spaceship goes BOOM when it touches an asteroid:

forever
  if <_______> then
    say [BOOM!]
    stop [all]
  end
end
challenges.hint: What should the spaceship check for? Think about what's dangerous in space...

tier1.teach: The spaceship needs to sense the asteroid. Use 'touching [asteroid]?' in the diamond.

tier2.teach: Asteroid = danger! Put 'touching asteroid' in the check spot!

challenges.prompt:
When your spaceship touches the right edge, make it appear on the left!

if <touching [edge]?> then
  _______
end
challenges.hint: Where is the left side of the screen? Think about negative x coordinates...

challenges.prompt: Every second you survive, add 1 to score! Build the code:
challenges.hint: Use a wait block and a change score block inside a forever loop

phase_4_independent.intro: Now finish building YOUR Space Dodger! Make it awesome!
tasks: Add 3 more asteroids (hint: duplicate the asteroid sprite)

phase_5_quiz.intro: Quick check - do you know your collision code?

questions.q: What block detects when sprites touch?
Why do we put collision detection in a forever loop?
questions.a: To check constantly, not just once

questions.q: What happens if the condition is FALSE?
questions.a: The code inside IF doesn't run

phase_6_complete.celebration: YOUR SPACE DODGER IS COMPLETE! Play it! Share it! You're a game developer!

project_templates.tagline: Create your own pet that responds to YOUR commands!
project_templates.what_kids_build: A virtual pet with hunger, happiness, and responses
project_templates.why_exciting: It's THEIR pet that talks back to them!

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: What if you could create your OWN pet that talks to you, gets hungry, and responds to your name? Let's build one!

teaching_script.gigi_says: Pets have feelings that CHANGE! In coding, we use VARIABLES to track things that change.
teaching_script.voice_text: Variables are like your pet's mood meters! Hunger, happiness, energy - they go up and down!

teaching_script.gigi_says: We can ASK questions and use the ANSWER!
teaching_script.voice_text: Ask gets your name. Answer stores it. Join puts words together. Your pet knows YOUR name!

rule_card.title: Variables & Input
rule_card.rule: Variables store things that change. ASK gets input. ANSWER stores what they typed!

walkthrough.voice: First, let's ask the player their name!
Now combine 'Hi' with their answer. The pet greets them personally!
Type your name... Hi Emma! The pet knows you!
Make a variable called hunger. Start it at 50.

walkthrough.action: if <key [f] pressed> then change hunger by -10
walkthrough.voice: Press F for food! Hunger goes down by 10.
Show the hunger level! Watch it change!

challenges.prompt:
Complete the code so your pet greets you:

ask [What's your name?] and wait
say (join [Hello ] _______)
challenges.hint: Where does your typed name get stored?

challenges.prompt:
When F key is pressed, decrease hunger by 10:

when [f] key pressed
_______
challenges.hint: Use change, not set! We want to subtract from current hunger.

challenges.prompt: If happiness > 50, pet says 'I love you!' else says 'Play with me!'
challenges.answer: if <(happiness) > (50)> then say [I love you!] else say [Play with me!]

phase_6_complete.celebration: YOUR VIRTUAL PET IS ALIVE! It knows your name, gets hungry, and has feelings!

project_templates.tagline: Find the bugs! Fix the code! Save the game!
project_templates.why_exciting: Detective mystery - they feel SMART finding bugs

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Oh no! The games are BROKEN! Someone introduced BUGS into the code. Can you find them and save the games?

teaching_script.gigi_says: A BUG is when code doesn't do what we want. Every programmer finds bugs - even the pros!
teaching_script.voice_text: Expected: move forward. Actual: goes backwards! That's a bug! Something's wrong with the number.

teaching_script.gigi_says: DEBUG strategy: 1) Read the code 2) Run it 3) Compare expected vs actual 4) Find the difference!

phase_3_guided_practice.intro: Time to hunt some bugs! Each mini-game is broken. Find and fix the bug!

challenges.scenario: The cat should say 'Hello!' when clicked, but nothing happens!
challenges.bug: Wrong event block - should be 'when this sprite clicked'
challenges.fix: Change 'when green flag clicked' to 'when this sprite clicked'

tier1.teach: Green flag means start of program. Sprite clicked means click on the cat. Different events!

challenges.scenario: Score should go UP when collecting coins, but it stays at 1!
challenges.buggy_code:
when this sprite clicked
set [score] to (1)
challenges.bug: Using SET instead of CHANGE - it resets to 1 every time!
challenges.fix: Change 'set score to 1' to 'change score by 1'

challenges.scenario: Spaceship should bounce at edges but just stops!
challenges.bug: stop [all] ends the game! Should turn around instead.

challenges.scenario: Should detect wall, but walks right through!
challenges.bug: Checking for 'floor' but wall is called 'wall'!

challenges.scenario: Pet should say your name, but just says 'Hello !'
challenges.bug: Using text 'answer' instead of the answer VARIABLE!
challenges.fix: Use the round (answer) variable block, not the text

phase_6_complete.celebration: ALL BUGS SQUASHED! You're a debugging EXPERT!

project_templates.tagline: Make cookies rain from the sky and catch them all!
project_templates.what_kids_build: A collecting game with falling objects and scoring
project_templates.why_exciting: Lots of things on screen = visual excitement, instant gratification

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: What if you could make HUNDREDS of cookies fall from the sky? With CLONES, you can make copies of sprites!

teaching_script.gigi_says: CLONES are copies. One cookie becomes many cookies!
Each clone runs its own code! Original makes clones, clones fall and disappear.

blocks: when I start as a clone
go to x: (pick random -200 to 200) y: (180)

challenges.prompt:
Complete the code to create a new cookie every 0.5 seconds:

forever
  _______
  wait (0.5) seconds
end

When clone starts, go to random x at top, then glide down:

when I start as a clone
_______
glide (2) secs to y: (-180)
delete this clone
challenges.answer: go to x: (pick random (-200) to (200)) y: (180)

challenges.prompt:
If clone touches the basket, add 1 to score and delete:

when I start as a clone
forever
  if <touching [basket]?> then
    _______
    delete this clone
  end
end

phase_6_complete.celebration: COOKIE RAIN IS FALLING! You made a real arcade game!

project_templates.tagline: Navigate the maze, find the key, escape the dungeon!
project_templates.what_kids_build: A complete maze adventure with keys, doors, and winning
project_templates.why_exciting: It's a REAL adventure game with multiple objectives

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: You're trapped in a dungeon! Find the key, unlock the door, and ESCAPE! But you'll need to code your way out!

teaching_script.gigi_says: Adventure games need MULTIPLE conditions! Wall detection + key collection + door unlocking!

conditions: touching door AND hasKey? ‚Üí YOU WIN!

challenges.prompt: If touching wall, go back to start position (0, 0):
challenges.answer: if <touching [wall]?> then go to x: (0) y: (0)

challenges.prompt: When touching key, set hasKey to 1 and hide the key:

Only escape if you HAVE the key:

if <<touching [door]?> and <(hasKey) = (1)>> then
  _______
end

phase_6_complete.celebration: YOU ESCAPED THE DUNGEON! You coded a complete adventure game!

summary.theme_consistency: All projects are GAMES kids want to build and play
summary.follows_lesson_flow: Yes - 6 phases (Rule Teaching ‚Üí Demo ‚Üí Guided ‚Üí Independent ‚Üí Quiz ‚Üí Complete)
